sub_title: Energy Market Modelling Expert at McKinsey & Company
summary: Over my professional career, I have grown to be a modelling expert in the energy industry. After studying Aerospace Engineering and Applied Physics in Delft, I kicked off my career as a Reservoir Engineer at Shell, where I made a living of forecasting and scenario building for investment decision making. I then dived into the world of algorithms and (big) data at Pipple, before starting a job at McKinsey. There, I grew to become a modelling expert across different energy markets, most notably gas and hydrogen trade optimizations. I enjoy the combination of diving into code, working in a project team and keeping focus on the business need. My professional interests are as broad as my technical background, but especially lie in global energy transition as well as transport and infrastructure.

[{'company': {'id': 1371, 'name': 'McKinsey & Company', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D560BAQGkMCCyZFcj-Q/company-logo_400_400/0/1688214173898?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=n_wKtc5mT0hprjji6faQOx8_Y2xGt3-3kGz9z-ljIto', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/mckinsey/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'McKinsey & Company', 'description': 'Designed and created:
- McKinsey’s Global Hydrogen Trade Model, the backbone of Hydrogen Council’s trade reports , predicting how hydrogen will be sourced to demand centres in the coming decades, using minimum cost optimization
- European gas pipeline model, balancing supply and demand, including intra-European pipeline flows, piped and LNG imports and gas storage 
- Hydrogen Navigator, balancing hydrogen and gas flows through Europe simultaneously where gas infrastructure can be re-used for hydrogen 

Applied these advanced analytics models to multiple client projects:
- Multi-billion dollar acquisition of a gas infrastructure asset in Europe
- Resulting demand and supply forecasts of gas during the Ukraine crisis
- Hydrogen sourcing strategy for a European steel player

Helped develop McKinsey’s modelling software platform Fusion, allowing advanced modelling and quick visualization in a low-code, online, environment

Also, I performed advanced analytics on a couple of HR-related issues for different companies.', 'title': 'Data Scientist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1271, 'name': 'Shell', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGN30g7aSl4NA/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856218579?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=HqIwwLBNmVKkXXiXnFVRbQwTX34PBz5TB2QZhtR3btU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/shell/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Nederlandse Aardolie Maatschappij, Assen', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Shell', 'description': 'Developed opportunities (two new wells, reopening of others) in the Southern North Sea, offshore The Netherlands. Currently (2015-2017) working on the Waddenzee fields, onshore The Netherlands.

Was responsible for all reservoir engineering activities in the Waddenzee/North Friesland: one of NAM’s largest gas-producing areas. Core business involves developing new opportunities to sustain production, therewith analysing dynamic data to understand both subsurface uncertainties as well as surface bottlenecks. It also involves reporting out on ground subsidence modelling to the regulator. The Waddenzee is an environmentally sensitive area and we all would like to keep it that way.

Developed formal and informal capabilities in geology, geophysics, petrophysics, production technology and economics.

Mastered expertise in numerical simulation using a wide range of methods. This involves combining many sources of data (production rates, pressures, RFT data, production logging data, well logging, seismic interpretation and geological understanding) into a forecasting output, with a realistic uncertainty range. This can be done conceptually, deterministically and probabilistically - all with their pros and cons.

Obtained experience in the following activities and/or software: Project Development Reservoir Engineering, Integrated Production Systems Modelling, Material Balance (MBAL) modelling, 3D Dynamic Simulation and Experimental Design, Ecrin Software & Well Test analysis, Business Planning, Reserves Booking, Reservoir Engineering for modelling of subsidence, Integrated 4D seismic studies.', 'title': 'Reservoir Engineer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1271, 'name': 'Shell Global Solutions', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGN30g7aSl4NA/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856218579?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=HqIwwLBNmVKkXXiXnFVRbQwTX34PBz5TB2QZhtR3btU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/shell/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rijswijk', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'Shell', 'description': '•	Performed theoretical, computational and experimental research on (shock) waves through granular materials, with joint expertise from two research centres.
